lose_facts.info: I know what you're thinking… “OMG I dont litter! I love the ocean!” But out of everything we throw away, less than 10% is actually recycled, and about 80% ends up in either landfills or the ocean!
lose_facts.tag: Fishes swim to survive, and avoid the trash!

lose_facts.info: Every minute, the equivalent of one truckload of trash enters the world’s oceans.
lose_facts.tag: Wanna last? You’re gonna need to swim fast

lose_facts.info: Swim for your life! There’s currently 363,762,732,605 pounds of TRASH in the world’s oceans
lose_facts.tag: This is a whale-y big problem!

lose_facts.info: If we continue at our current rate of consumption, by 2050 there will be more trash in the ocean than fish.
lose_facts.tag: That would be an ofishal catastrophe.

lose_facts.info: As time passes, trash breaks down into smaller pieces and microplastics, which contaminates ecosystems and is directly responsible for killing over a MILLION marine animals every year.
lose_facts.tag: Soon, there won't be a lot of fish in the sea.

lose_facts.info: Unfortunately, microplastics have already spread across the globe as they’ve been documented everywhere from samples of Arctic Sea ice, to the top of Mount Everest.  A clear plastic produce bag holds the record for deepest piece of plastic, as it currently sits at the bottom of the Mariana Trench, 36,000 feet below sea level.
lose_facts.tag: There’s literally nowhere left to swim…

lose_facts.info: About 100 million marine animals die each year just from plastic waste!
Experts believe there’s more than 5.25 TRILLION individual pieces of trash in the ocean alongside upwards of 51 TRILLION microplastics polluting ecosystems.

Trash does not just float on the surface,  at least 11.1 billion pieces of plastic trash are entangled into coral reefs, harming the coral as well as more than 7,000 species that comprise its ecosystem.

pickles are not real. they arent they are just pickled cucumbers. no one would call a pickled apple a pickle, it would still just be an apple. therefore i thinky its stupid to call them pickles. stupid and a lie. when i found out the truth i felt betrayed. i thought they grew in the ground. i thought they were their own species. but alas it is just yet another government lie.
